metadata.title: CVE-2015-1290 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The Google V8 engine, as used in Google Chrome before 44.0.2403.89 andQtWebEngineCore in Qt before 5.5.1, allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (memory corruption) or execute arbitrary code via acrafted web site.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1290` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
